summary: ActivityInterface adds a string index signature to any interface that extends it, allowing TypeScript to accept any method call on proxy objects without type checking. This creates a mismatch between compile-time and runtime behavior where invalid method calls compile but fail at runtime.
userImpact: Developers lose type safety when using proxyActivities with custom activity interfaces, allowing invalid method calls to compile and only fail at runtime.
rootCause: ActivityInterface includes a string index signature that gets inherited by any interface extending it, allowing TypeScript to accept arbitrary property access on proxy objects.
proposedFix: Change proxyActivities to return a mapped type that only includes valid ActivityFunction methods, such as using Pick<T, KeysWhere<T, ActivityFunction>> to filter to conforming methods only.
workaround: Use a utility type like ActivityInterfaceFor<T> = Pick<T, keyof {[K in keyof T as T[K] extends ActivityFunction<any[], any> ? K : never]: T[K]}> to wrap the proxy result and provide proper type filtering.
resolutionDetails: Changed the type signature to use a mapped type that filters activities to only those conforming to ActivityFunction, improving type safety and preventing invalid method calls from compiling.
keyQuote: You won't get any completions from the TS language server for undeclared properties but compilation still passes so that's not great
